Text:
Met with @LCVoters today to discuss critical provisions in @POTUS’ #BuildBackBetter Act that will take critical steps in combatting the Climate Crisis, create good-paying American jobs, & fight environmental injustices. 

We must come together & get this historic bill passed.

My office will remain in close contact with all necessary federal, state, & local officials & we are monitoring this situation closely. We will ensure information is readily available & communicated effectively as soon as we have more details on this emergency response situation.

I’ve been on the phone with the Mayor, @EPA, & the state of MI given reports of a chemical leak in Flat Rock. Right now, the EPA & EGLE are investigating & have deployed emergency responders to quickly determine the source of the leak.

Our nation’s long-term care system needs serious work!

This week, @SenBobCasey & I joined @SecBecerra to discuss how our #BetterCareBetterJobs Act will fix our nation’s long-term care so seniors & people with disabilities can get the care they need in the setting of their choice

As we work toward a net-zero future, battery tech will only become more important to our everyday lives. 

It’s critical we invest NOW in increasing domestic battery production to keep us at the forefront of innovation & tech while creating good-paying jobs. #NationalBatteryDay https://t.co/GuIt0fSjKW

For too long, millions of seniors, people with disabilities, & direct care workers have been failed by our nation’s long-term care system. 
 
On #NationalCaregiversDay, we must continue fighting for strong investments in long-term care by passing my Better Care Better Jobs Act. https://t.co/jpdRXvvuUT

These severe weather events are why Congress worked in a bipartisan manner to pass strong investments in our nation’s infrastructure with the #BipartisanInfrastructureLaw. Together, these investments will make communities more resilient while combatting the Climate Crisis.

From wildfires in the West to “once-in-a-generation” storms in the Midwest to strong hurricanes in the East—every community throughout the US felt the impacts of last year’s increasingly severe weather events.

https://t.co/ymPBGyZMqS

Today, @RepElaineLuria & I led 49 of our colleagues in calling on @SecDef to require TRICARE to cover at-home COVID tests for service members & military families.

Private health care & Medicare are already required to cover test kits—we must do the same for our service members.

Our #GreatLakes are a way of life – they support the economy, stand up good-paying jobs, & allow access to outdoor recreation. Proud to have secured infrastructure investments like this & look forward to working with @EPA to protect the Great Lakes for generations to come.

Cleaning up our Great Lakes has been a long time coming. This strong investment will speed up the cleanup process to protect against invasive species & contaminants across the region. https://t.co/NBwnbWxred

We must get these contaminated sites cleaned up. That’s why we included strong funding for the #BrownfieldsProgram in the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law. Now, we must ensure that funding get to where it needs to go so we can protect public health & our environment.

140 MILLION Americans live within a few short miles of contaminated properties, known as brownfield sites. This @EPA map shows just how prevalent brownfield sites are: https://t.co/BNuGBaaEZW https://t.co/DWELYpuEpA

We need Canadian authorities to get this bridge back up and running immediately so Michigan’s vibrant economy can return to normal and support hardworking families.
This closure is impacting daily lives, forcing workers to stay home and miss paychecks, halting production at auto plants, and preventing the critical flow of goods between Michigan and Ontario.
Hardworking Michigan families are feeling the brunt of this border closure, and the blockade is further delaying manufacturing – especially in the auto industry – in the United States.
We need to reopen the bridge now, it’s as simple as that. I support the right to protest, but we can do so without impacting our economy and our workers in Michigan and beyond.

I will continue fighting to close this nonsensical loophole that’s putting survivors of domestic abuse at risk every single day.
However, I’m disappointed this bill fails to retain my provision to close the boyfriend loophole – which would prevent people with a history of domestic abuse from accessing guns.
